segments.en: Linked Discourses 55
6. A Wise Person
54. Sick

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṃ karonti:
segments.en: At that time several mendicants were making a robe for the Buddha, thinking that
when his robe was finished and the three months of the rains residence had passed the Buddha would set out wandering.
Mahānāma the Sakyan heard about this.

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then he went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him that he had heard that the Buddha was leaving. He added,

segments.pli: Na kho netaṃ, bhante, bhagavato sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ
segments.en: “Sir, I haven’t heard and learned it in the presence of the Buddha

segments.pli: sappaññena upāsakena sappañño upāsako ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno ovaditabbo”ti.
segments.en: how a wise lay follower should advise another wise lay follower who is sick, suffering, gravely ill.”

segments.pli: “Sappaññena, mahānāma, upāsakena sappañño upāsako ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno catūhi assāsanīyehi dhammehi assāsetabbo:
segments.en: “Mahānāma, a wise lay follower should put at ease another wise lay follower who is sick, suffering, gravely ill with four consolations.
‘Be at ease, sir.

segments.pli: atthāyasmato buddhe aveccappasādo itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
segments.en: You have experiential confidence in the Buddha …
the teaching …
the Saṅgha …
And you have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.’

segments.pli: Sappaññena, mahānāma, upāsakena sappañño upāsako ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno imehi catūhi assāsanīyehi dhammehi assāsetvā evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: When a wise lay follower has put at ease another wise lay follower who is sick, suffering, gravely ill with these four consolations, they should say:
‘Are you concerned for your mother and father?’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘atthi me mātāpitūsu apekkhā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: ‘I am,’ they should say:
‘But sir, it’s your nature to die.
Whether or not you are concerned for your mother and father,

segments.pli: no cepāyasmā mātāpitūsu apekkhaṃ karissati, marissateva.
segments.en: you will die anyway.

segments.pli: Sādhāyasmā, yā te mātāpitūsu apekkhā taṃ pajahā’ti.
segments.en: It would be good to give up concern for your mother and father.’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘yā me mātāpitūsu apekkhā sā pahīnā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: ‘I have given up concern for my mother and father,’ they should say:
‘But are you concerned for your partners and children?’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘atthi me puttadāresu apekkhā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: ‘I am,’ they should say:
‘But sir, it’s your nature to die.
Whether or not you are concerned for your partners and children,

segments.pli: no cepāyasmā puttadāresu apekkhaṃ karissati, marissateva.
segments.en: you will die anyway.

segments.pli: Sādhāyasmā, yā te puttadāresu apekkhā taṃ pajahā’ti.
segments.en: It would be good to give up concern for your partners and children.’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘yā me puttadāresu apekkhā sā pahīnā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: ‘I have given up concern for my partners and children,’ they should say:
‘But are you concerned for the five kinds of human sensual stimulation?’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘atthi me mānusakesu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu apekkhā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: ‘I am,’ they should say:

segments.pli: ‘mānusakehi kho, āvuso, kāmehi dibbā kāmā abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca.
segments.en: ‘Good sir, heavenly sensual pleasures are better than human sensual pleasures.

segments.pli: Sādhāyasmā, mānusakehi kāmehi cittaṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā cātumahārājikesu devesu cittaṃ adhimocehī’ti.
segments.en: It would be good to turn your mind away from human sensual pleasures and fix it on the gods of the Four Great Kings.’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘mānusakehi me kāmehi cittaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ, cātumahārājikesu devesu cittaṃ adhimocitan’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: ‘I have done so,’ they should say:

segments.pli: ‘cātumahārājikehi kho, āvuso, devehi tāvatiṃsā devā abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca.
segments.en: ‘Good sir, the gods of the Thirty Three are better than the gods of the Four Great Kings …

segments.pli: Sādhāyasmā, cātumahārājikehi devehi cittaṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā tāvatiṃsesu devesu cittaṃ adhimocehī’ti.
‘cātumahārājikehi me devehi cittaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ, tāvatiṃsesu devesu cittaṃ adhimocitan’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
‘tāvatiṃsehi kho, āvuso, devehi yāmā devā … pe …
segments.en: Good sir, the gods of Yama …
the Joyful Gods …
the Gods Who Love to Create …
the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others …

segments.pli: paranimmitavasavattīhi kho, āvuso, devehi brahmaloko abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
segments.en: the Gods of the Brahmā realm are better than the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others.

segments.pli: Sādhāyasmā, paranimmitavasavattīhi devehi cittaṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā brahmaloke cittaṃ adhimocehī’ti.
segments.en: It would be good to turn your mind away from the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others and fix it on the Gods of the Brahmā realm.’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘paranimmitavasavattīhi me devehi cittaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ, brahmaloke cittaṃ adhimocitan’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
segments.en: ‘I have done so,’ they should say:
‘Good sir, the Brahmā realm is impermanent, not lasting, and included within identity.

segments.pli: Sādhāyasmā, brahmalokā cittaṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā sakkāyanirodhe cittaṃ upasaṃharāhī’ti.
segments.en: It would be good to turn your mind away from the Brahmā realm and apply it to the cessation of identity.’
If they reply,

segments.pli: ‘brahmalokā me cittaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ, sakkāyanirodhe cittaṃ upasaṃharāmī’ti;
segments.en: ‘I have done so,’

segments.pli: evaṃ vimuttacittassa kho, mahānāma, upāsakassa āsavā vimuttacittena bhikkhunā na kiñci nānākaraṇaṃ vadāmi, yadidaṃ—
segments.en: then there is no difference between a lay follower whose mind is freed in this way and a mendicant whose mind is freed from defilements; that is,
between the freedom of one and the other.”

suttaplex.blurb: Mahānāma asks the Buddha how a lay follower should teach a wise lay follower who is ill. He should first be encouraged in the four factors of stream-entry, and then urged to let go of attachments, until he realizes full freedom.
